backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor with no implemented logic.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report describing a logo replacement update affecting HeroSection.tsx.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file containing short summaries of several frontend components updated for branding and wording changes.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind config and CSS variables defining theming for light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: Base HTML shell providing metadata and loading the React app entrypoint.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main app component rendering the LandingPage.
frontend/src/components/landing/LandingP: Landing page composition combining all main marketing sections.
frontend/src/components/landing/sections: Section with a Calendly CTA and supporting text linking to consultation scheduling.
Displays three case studies with metrics and improvements achieved.
Footer showing copyright info and a link to caffeine.ai.
Hero banner with brand logo, headline, credentials, and CTA scroll button.
Offer section highlighting service value, focus areas, and CTA to book an audit.
Fourâ€‘step process section explaining the engagement workflow.
frontend/src/config/marketing.ts: Exports marketing constants including Calendly URL and company info.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches a backend actor based on the current Internet Identity, invalidating related queries on identity change.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and utilities for managing Internet Identity login, stored identities, and authentication state.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base layers and design tokens for light/dark themes and custom utilities using OKLCH color variables.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app, wrapping it with React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind with custom colors, themes, plugins, and design tokens sourced from CSS variables.
project_state.json: Tracks project state, features, and pending requests related to replacing the app's wordmark with a user-provided logo.
